did you recently upgrade from vbox-free to the vbox version on their website?
how many VM images do you have?
try the following (once I get Vbox installed/setup)
open up your Home Folder
select  'View -> Show Hidden Files' in the toolbar then scroll down and find the folder:  .VirtualBox
ensure that all instances of VirtualBox are closed. Then rename that folder from .VirtualBox to .VirtualBox.old
it says:  .VirtualBox-1.7 ?
yeah, that should be fine
now go into  'Applications -> Accessories -> VirtualBox OSE#
look at the nautilus home folder
a new directory should be created
just go into .VirtualBox-1.7.old , then highlight the 'HardDisks' folder
move to the new .VirtualBox directory and paste
once you've moved over the Hard Disk image, it should all be good to go :)
